DataElement.preferredDefinition: The study arm assigned to an individual based on the method used to include them in the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The affected family member who seeks medical attention for a genetic disorder thereby bringing the family under study.:A planned pathway assigned to the subject as they progress through the study, usually referred to by a name that reflects one or more treatments, exposures, and/or controls included in the path._An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The affected family member who seeks medical attention for a genetic disorder thereby bringing the family under study._A planned pathway assigned to the subject as they progress through the study, usually referred to by a name that reflects one or more treatments, exposures, and/or controls included in the path._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affected family member who seeks medical attention for a genetic disorder thereby bringing the family under study._The establishment of a state or result._Genetic screening that is performed on the biological relatives of individuals diagnosed with specific genetic conditions.

PermissibleValues.value: Arm 2: Direct contact of FDRs by site staff

ValueMeaning.preferredName: First Degree Relative Direct Personal Contact
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)_As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption._Direct or indirect interaction between individuals or organizations.

Concepts.definition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)
As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.
Direct or indirect interaction between individuals or organizations.
